BinarySearchTree< T > Class Template Reference

A templated tree to perform a binary search, with some extra features to search by a key (long) and to return a node's data, or replace a specified node. More...

#include <BinarySearchTree.h>

Inheritance diagram for BinarySearchTree< T >:

[legend]
Collaboration diagram for BinarySearchTree< T >:

[legend]

 Destructor.

 Assignment Operator override.
.
bool search (const T &searchItem) const
 Search for the given item, returns true if found.
.
void getNodeValue (const long &searchKey, T &outNode) const
 Get the value of the node found using the given search key (long).
.
bool searchByKey (const long &searchKey) const
 Search the binary search tree, using the given search key (long), returns true if found.
.
bool replaceNode (const long &searchKey, const T &nodeData)
 Search for a node matching the given key (long), and replace it's data with the given node data value, returning true if successful.
.
void insert (const T &dataToInsert)
 Insert the given item into the search tree, creating a new node if successful, but aborting if a duplicate is found in the tree.
.
void deleteNode (const T &deleteItem)
 If a node with the same data as the given item is found, it is deleted from the binary search tree.
.
void inOrderDump (vector< T > &vect) const
 Perform an in-order traversal of the tree, outputting its contents to the given vector.
.
void preOrderDump (vector< T > &vect) const
 Perform a pre-order traversal of the tree, outputting its contents to the given vector.
.
void postOrderDump (vector< T > &vect) const
 Perform a post-order traversal of the tree, outputting its contents to the given vector.
.

 Delete (from the binary search tree) the node to which p points.

 Perform an in-order traversal, printing each node to a T vector.
.
void fillVectorPreOrder (vector< T > &vect, nodeType< T > *p) const
 Perform a pre-order traversal, printing each node to a T vector.

void fillVectorPostOrder (vector< T > &vect, nodeType< T > *p) const

Detailed Description

template<class T>
class BinarySearchTree< T >

Derived from SimpleBinaryTree, implementing its abstract methods.

template<class T>
bool BinarySearchTree< T >::search ( const T &  searchItem  )  const [inline, virtual]

Search the tree using the specified item (T). Arguments: T

Parameters:
searchItem (T) the item used for searching through the nodes of the tree.
Returns:
true if found.
Search the binary search tree for the given T. Type T must have equality and greater than comparison operators defined.
// Assignment op overload. Search the binary search tree for the given T. Returns true if found.

Implements SimpleBinaryTree< T >.

template<class T>
void BinarySearchTree< T >::insert ( const T &  dataToInsert  )  [inline, virtual]

Insert the given item (T) into the tree. Arguments: T

Parameters:
dataToInsert (T) the item to insert.
Insert the given item into the search tree. Creates a new node if successful. Aborts if a duplicate item is found in the tree.
Insert the given item into the search tree. Creates a new node if successful. Aborts if a duplicate item is found in the tree.

00512                 while(current != 0)

00515

00530                                 current = current->right;
00531                         }

00536

00538                 {
00539                         // Make the new node the LEFT child of trailCurrent.
00540                         trailCurrent->left = newNode;
00541                 }

template<class T>
void BinarySearchTree< T >::deleteNode ( const T &  deleteItem  )  [inline, virtual]

If the binary search tree is empty or deleteItem is not in the tree, a message is printed.

Search for the given T and if found, delete it from the tree. Arguments: T

Parameters:
deleteItem (T) the item to be deleted.
If a node with the same data as the given item is found, it is deleted from the binary search tree. If the binary search tree is empty or deleteItem is not in the tree, a message is printed.
If a node with the same data as the given item is found, it is deleted from the binary search tree. If the binary search tree is empty or deleteItem is not in the tree, a message is printed.

Implements SimpleBinaryTree< T >.

00563         nodeType<T> * predecessor;      // pointer used in CASE 4.
00564         nodeType<T> * trailCurrent;     // pointer behind predecessor.
00565 
00566         if (p == 0)
00567         {
00568                 cout << "Error: the node to be deleted is NULL." << endl;
00569         }
00570         else if(p->left == 0 && p->right == 0)
00571         {
00572 
00573                 // CASE 1
00574                 // Node to be deleted has no right or left subtree.
00575                 // Go ahead and delete the node.
00576                 temp = p;
00577                 p = 0;
00578                 delete temp;
00579         }
00580         else if(p->left == 0)
00581         {
00582 
00583                 // CASE 2
00584                 // Node to be deleted has no left subtree.
00585                 // Bypass and then delete.
00586                 temp = p;
00587                 p = temp->right; // Bypass.
00588                 delete temp;
00589         }
00590         else if(p->right == 0)
00591         {
00592 
00593                 // CASE 3
00594                 // Node to be deleted has no right subtree.
00595                 // Bypass and then delete.
00596                 temp = p;
00597                 p = temp->left; // Bypass.
00598                 delete temp;
00599         }
00600         else
00601         {
00602 
00603                 // CASE 4
00604                 // Node to be deleted has left and right subtrees.
00605                 // Find the predecessor of the node to be deleted...
00606 
00607                 // Go left.
00608                 predecessor = p->left;
00609                 trailCurrent = 0;
00610 
00611                 // Go right until null.
00612                 while (predecessor->right != 0)
00613                 {
00614                         trailCurrent = predecessor;
00615                         predecessor = predecessor->right;
00616                 }
00617 
00618                 //   predecessor->right == NULL
00619 
00620                 //   Overwrite the data of the node to be deleted,
00621                 //   "swapping" in the data of the predecessor.
00622                 p->data = predecessor->data; // Perform the "swap"
00623 
00624 
00625 
00626                 // Bypass the predecessor.
00627                 if (trailCurrent == 0)
00628                 {
00629                         // predecessor did not move.
00630                         // predecessor == p->left.
00631                         // we need to adjust p.
00632 
00633                         p -> left = predecessor -> left; // bypass predecessor
00634                 }
00635                 else
00636                 {
00637                         // predecessor has no right subtree.
00638                         // Get the left subtree of predecessor (might be NULL anyway. Does not matter)
00639                         // ...call it LS
00640                         // Set the right subtree of trailCurrent to LS.
00641                         // predecessor has now been bypassed.
00642 
00643                         trailCurrent->right = predecessor->left; // bypass predecessor
00644                 }
00645 
00646                 // Predecessor has been bypassed.
00647                 // Delete the predecessor.
00648 
00649                 delete predecessor;
00650                 predecessor = 0;
00651         }
00652 }
